tit.e: Kenka Ryoseibai (in a quarrel both parties are to blame)

tit.cmt: タイトルのため、補足を削除しました。

sen.j: 喧嘩両成敗（けんかりょうせいばい）とは、中世日本の法 (法学)原則の1つ。
sen.e: Kenka Ryoseibai was a principle of law (jurisprudence) in Medieval Japan.

sen.cmt: 一部表現を補足しました。

sen.j: 喧嘩に際してその理非を問わず、双方とも均しく処罰するという原則。
sen.e: The principle provides that both parties which resorted to violence in a conflict should be equally punished regardless of the right or wrong of the matter.
sen.cmt: 本項では「喧嘩」は口論ではなく争いを暴力で解決しようとすることを意味しおりますが、この文章ではそのことを明示するために訳出しました。

sen.j: 中世後半になると、社会が不安定となり、境相論などを訴訟によらず実力によって解決（自力救済）しようとする故戦防戦が頻発するようになる。
sen.e: In the late medieval period, as the nation became unsettled, kosen bosen (offensive and defensive war) broke out frequently to resolve disputes over the boundaries of territories or the like by force (self-help) instead of by bringing them into court.

sen.j: こうした考え方は戦国時代 (日本)の分国法にも取り入れられ、今川氏の今川仮名目録では「喧嘩におよぶ輩は理非を論ぜず双方とも死罪」「喧嘩を仕掛けられても堪忍してこらえ･･とりあえず穏便に振る舞ったことは道理にしたがったと･･して罪を免ぜられるべき」（第8条）とある。
sen.e: Its idea was also introduced into bunkokuho (the law individual sengoku-daimyo enforced in their own domain) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states): Imagawa Kana Mokuroku (Kana List of Articles of the Imagawa) of the Imagawa family laid down that 'those who engaged in an armed conflict were both to be executed, irrespective of the question of right or wrong' 'who having borne and controlled himself under the provocation... and peacefully settled the matter for the moment was judged as reasonable..., and was to be exempt from punishment' (Article 8.)

Its idea was also introduced into bunkokuho (the law individual sengoku-daimyo [Japanese territorial lord in the Sengoku period] enforced in their own domain) in the Sengoku period (period of warring states) (Japan): Imagawa Kana Mokuroku (Kana List of Articles of the Imagawa) of the Imagawa clan laid down that 'those who engaged in an armed conflict were both to be executed, irrespective of the question of right or wrong,' and 'who having borne and controlled himself under the provocation... and peacefully settled the matter for the moment was judged as reasonable..., and was to be exempt from punishment' (Article 8).
sen.cmt: (日本） を追加しました。Imagawa clan としました。

sen.j: 武田氏の甲州法度之次第には、「喧嘩はどの様な理由があろうと処罰するが、喧嘩を仕掛けられても、我慢した者は処罰しない」とある。
